intro: Liabum coriaceum f. subcordatum, commonly known as the broad-leafed liabum, is a variant of the broad-leaved liabum, characterized by its distinctive, heart-shaped leaves. This plant belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is native to parts of southern Europe. Its leaves are typically broad, lobed, and have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in umbels. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats.
